website_summaries.verdict: The North Face captures the attention of outdoor lovers through their very own Storm III Waterproof. This watertight hiking shoe received excellent reviews, mainly thanks to its incredible comfort. Its great performance on trails can also be attributed to its grippy outsole, durable build, and breathable structure, to name a few. It fell short on the width department though. To summarize, even though it does not seem to be the best choice for hikers with a wide foot, its characteristics make it hard to ignore.
pros: The North Face Storm III Waterproof runs true to size, according to the majority
Most owners were exhilarated with its comfy interior
They added that it was a perfect shoe for hiking
Many male purchasers commented that The North Face men’s Storm III Waterproof was indeed a durable footgear
Numerous users praised its sticky outsole
The Storm III Waterproof pleased hikers with its ability to breathe well, keeping their foot cozy
Its impressive lightness delighted a considerable number of owners
A bunch of online buyers mentioned that it was able to protect them against wet encounters
cons: A small percentage of wearers declared that it was a bit restrictive in the toe box area

customer_reviews.title: They're actually waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I had some Merrels but also had soaking feet every time it rained. These boots keep my feet dry! Except when co-workers turn the heat up so they can pretend they're at the beach in winter, or something, then my feet get sweaty, but not the boots' fault
customer_reviews.author: Christian M Jean

customer_reviews.title: Light comfortable and waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box as comfortable as can be. Really amazing. Nice and light too. Have been in light rain, worked around the farm, have hiked and power washed all day in them. Feet are comfy and DRY! I replaced (as I do in all shoes) the insert with a Dr Scholl memory foam insoles which just take them to a whole new level! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful One

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of hiking shoes, color is totally off
customer_reviews.text: I love the pair. It is comfortable, waterproof and is well built. The color is not what is shown in the picture. Even the description says it is brown, in reality it is gray.
customer_reviews.author: DevB

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of hikers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 13 year old who loves to hike. He said they are very comfortable but keep his feet hot and dry.
customer_reviews.author: cared99

customer_reviews.title: move on, these aren't the ones you want
customer_reviews.text: these boots will make your feet wet. front lip is peeling and not like the old vibram soles I had before... find another pair
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Good looking hiking boot. The size was right on target, and the treads on the show are nice and grippy. The shoe is a bit stiff but this should loosen up with normal wear.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE

customer_reviews.title: Really nice... but I returned as too small
customer_reviews.text: Great looking, but too tight for my feet... NF must run small, & they didn't have next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable soles
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of North Face shoes over the years so I felt confident ordering these in my size without the ability to try on first. That was a mistake. I don't know what they use in the soles but these shoes killed my feet on the bottom side.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality boot !
customer_reviews.text: I wear and ordered a 9 1/2 and they fit perfect. Very comfortable to wear all day .
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Was snug width wise out of the box but after wearing for 2 hours they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey b

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still no hard use but it seems to behave well with rain
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Very sturdy and warm and do a great job keeping my feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They needed no breaking in and are very comfortable plus they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I need to be exchanged for others
customer_reviews.text: what is used for the park and field and are open at the tip in a short time is why I do not recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes. Will buy again. Awesome water profing.
customer_reviews.text: I got previous model mid II. Size 10.5. perfect fit for narrow width leg. If your feet is wide go one size larger. Used to climb Mt. Kilimanjaro in 2017 and just now on 6 day Hike to Machu Picchu. On recent hike/climb it was tested thoroughly for water profing and it hold up. Not a single drop sip inside crossing through heave rain and mir. Sole still intact and traction awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Hopeful
customer_reviews.text: Selling points - sturdy/solid materials and simplistic appearance (planning on using in the city too on international trip). Yet to test the goods, but promising!
customer_reviews.author: J

product_meta.title: THE NORTH FACE Storm III Mid Waterproof Boot Mens
product_meta.description: Kick up the dust as you trek from sunup to sundown in The North Face® Storm III Mid WP hiking boot. HydroSeal™ breathable, waterproof technology protects feet from outside elements. Durable mesh and supportive suede leather upper materials. Lace-up closure. Heel pull loop. Padded tongue and collar. Breathable fabric lining offers a great in-shoe feel. Molded OrthoLite® foam insole. Compression-molded EVA midsole. ESS Snake Plate™ provides forefoot protection from the trail. Vibram® XS Trek outsole delivers rugged grip and traction. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 1 lb 3 oz Product measurements were taken using size 12, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Heel pull loop. Padded tongue and collar. Breathable fabric lining offers a great in-shoe feel. Molded OrthoLite® foam insole. Compression-molded EVA midsole. ESS Snake Plate™ provides forefoot protection from the trail. Vibram® XS Trek outsole delivers rugged grip and traction. Imported.
